text: 1970 Atlantic hurricane season First storm started: May 17, 1970 Last storm ended: October 28, 1970 Strongest storm: Hurricane Celia - 945 mbar, 125 mph winds Number of storms: 10 named storms Major hurricanes (Cat. 3+) 2 Cost of damage: $453.8 million (1970 USD) $2.6 billion (2009 USD) People killed: 71 Closest Seasons: 1968, 1969, 1970, 1971, 1972 The 1970 Atlantic hurricane season was the period of time in 1970 that tropical cyclones formed in Atlantic Ocean. It officially began on June 1, 1970, and it ended on November 30, 1970. Strong storms of 1970 include Hurricane Celia, which killed 20 people and caused severe damage. Also, Tropical Storm Dorothy killed 51 people, most in Martinique. ==Storms== These are the names of the tropical cyclones that formed in the season: ImageSize = width:800 height:200 PlotArea = top:10 Hurricane Scale)" ==Storm names== These are the names set aside for 1970. Names that were not used are in . * Alma * Becky * Celia * Dorothy * Ella * Felice * Greta * * * * * * * * * * * * * * ===Retirement=== After this season there was one name that got retired: Celia. In 1974, the name "Carmen" was used instead. ==Related pages== * Lists of tropical cyclone names * Tropical cyclone ==Other websites== *Detailed information on all storms from 1970 Category:Atlantic hurricane seasons Atlantic hurricane season Category:1970s in weather
